Having galloped safely through the French, he reached afield behind the copse across which our men, regardless of orders, were running and descending the valley. That moment of moral hesitation which decides the fate of bat- 
tles had arrived. Would this disorderly crowd of soldiers attend to the voice of their command- er, or would they, disregarding him, continue their flight? Despite his desperate shouts that used to seem so terrible to the soldie
